En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon in consideration of the symptoms and in section of theirs.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The symptoms are many special ones, by many manners, according to the reminiscence of theirs, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of them by two manners, of which one is by the special kind of symptoms within themselves; and because of what they receive from the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is proper to the places in which the body's accidents happen, because the accidental symptom in the head is different from the accidental symptom in the buttocks; and the symptom in the place of flesh accident is different from the symptom in the joint; and each one of them has its own judgement by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more symptoms are some which should not be punctured, but rather allowed to mature with the healing in those or their completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other symptoms which should be punctured when they are crossed (i.e. matured), and not allowed to mature according to their completion. Such as symptoms that are proper to the joints, for a symptom when it is near a joint, its growth spreads inside and causes corruption of the ligaments or nerves of that joint, thereby causing contraction of that member; or it is a symptom proper to the main part, and if you delay the puncture of it until it has matured more in the main part; or it is a symptom proper to the anus, therefore puncture it before it has matured; and do not puncture it when it is already crossed (i.e. matured), for imperfect digestion, but that which is proper to the anus, so that you may not feel its prolapse and be elongated towards the inner parts of the anus, and cause a fistula, or that something is formed in the term of it that will not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Més és clar: la hora de la perforació del símptoma depèn de la seva maduració. Quan el símptoma s'ha maturat, llavors és el moment adequat per a la perforació.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is matured when there is the resolution of pain and cessation of fever, and the decrease in swelling and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know that the perforation will occur in the place most below the abscess and from pus coming from the cure of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the perforation will be through the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the muscles or tendons, and in the places of the ligaments; and, finally, in all places where there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use perforation according to the member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy location, it's better to leave the perforation until after it has been digested according to its completeness, as we said; because if you perforate that before digestion, it will lengthen the course of healing and make the edges of the wound hard and swollen, and weaken the depth of the abscess.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are pierced according to the latitude of the flesh or body as necessity demands, or according to that which the member requires. (In other words, sometimes perforation is necessary and should be done immediately, regardless of the location.)
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small perforation, and in large abscesses, a large perforation, and wide or many sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses. (In other words, the size of the perforation should be proportional to the size of the abscess.)
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are abscesses in which the cord should be cut and enclosed, when it is made like bread or made to be in a state that it is already hardened, such as those that occur in many cases of diphtheria and boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those are that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those in which it is incised like the shape of a myrrh leaf, such as the abscesses of the anus.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those are that are incised with a round section and a crescent-shaped section, and similar to those (others).
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But as for that one which cannot be incised like surface abscesses, such as those of the lions (i.e. elephantiasis), it is necessary to pierce it with a superficial or flat perforation only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is necessary when the abscess is large and has already accumulated much pus, that you pierce it and do not worry about extracting all of the pus at once; having extracted a part from it, close the wound with a dressing by night, and tomorrow extract a larger part, and thus repeat this process many times until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a youth of robust virtue, or an old woman in her prime, or a young child, because the animal spirit is many times resolved with the evacuation of the pus, and soon the patient will die, and you will open them (i.e. perform an autopsy).
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Save this chapter with great care, and have in mind the perforation which you make for these abscesses, it is necessary to abstain from plagues and consider if the plague of the abscess is slight or a flat section, then you can administer those drugs of lime or of old cotton; and if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then it is necessary that you insert a thread in each hole until they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord has been cut or it has become concave within the circuit, then it is necessary that you fill it with old cotton or with a thread made from linen fabric, as when you have pressed bread or raisins to remove their moisture; and strengthen that for three days; and then proceed with it and cure the wound with the same process as for other ointments until it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding or flow of blood occurs during the time of your operation, then you administer hot water and vinegar in which a cloth made of linen is soaked, and apply that to the location of the bleeding many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding continues, then it is necessary that you administer remedies and treatments and powders which have been recommended in many places of this our book and its divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the location of the abscess is near nerves that have been cut, then you must fill with poultices of wine and hot oil, and place them on the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the affected areas are fleshy, then you must place poultices soaked in water and oil or wine and oil on them, and wash them every three days, just as we have said, and then lance the abscess and clean the area with whatever treatment seems best for him until he is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is the general knowledge required for the treatment of abscesses universally, but as I have said earlier, according to the method of distinction, there are different types of abscesses and their treatments are specific in each case.

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	It seems we're discussing a specific type of abscess.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the small veins of the head, pustules appear, and especially nodules which contain tunics that are formed at their site; and these nodules themselves are called "morsos".
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them are pimples, and those which contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those some which contain moisture similar to dust, and similar to them; and from those which are petrified, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you should extract them does not cause harm or contradiction with alchemy.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you enclose them with an instrument of which form is similar to this, which is called "entromes", so that you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	If what is contained in it is moisture, the hours to separate it with section according to length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And it starts from the section of the line of .B. to the line of .G.. Therefore, when the moisture is evacuated, then you will excorate that which contains that moisture, and do not leave any cause in it, because many times seen that it returns if there remains some cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge it in Egyptian pitch, if present, and otherwise in water and salt; and fill that with the plague [or disease] and leave it for another day, because in that water it will corrode all that remains of its peel.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And it is fitting to apply a second and third Egyptian ointment to that spot, according to necessity, so that you are confident there will be no remaining cause for that scab; then cure the wound with an ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess has thick knots, you will incise it in this way:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	in the shape of a cross cut it with one incision between two lips of the section and remove all that surrounds it, and make an effort to extract the cloth which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your archery gives you contrary treatment, do what I recounted to you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the inflamed abscess of section and cure according to what we have said to you; and the incision on an inflamed abscess is less painful, because it is with little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are such cases of these abscesses which are in the head of some men where they have not at all moisture; and this is because you incised on an abscess in the head of an old woman and found a hard, rough, white scab that could not be broken, and if anyone had struck it, would have hurt them.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other cases of accidents on the head that are not like this one, such as abscesses that appear on the heads of children and the ears, but the section for all these is superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the incision of those in the lower part of them, for the sake of relieving their bodies from the sickness to the lower parts. (Note: This text seems to be written in an archaic style and may require some interpretation)
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And apply a proper cure to those who need it according to what is suitable for the treatment. (Note: This text seems to be concluding the instructions and emphasizing the importance of proper care)

De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	A cutting of scrofulas that occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	They are usually found in the neck and armpits and groin; and sometimes occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and those many which are generated therefrom, and all the scrophula of those is contained in its own tunic, and so as with the boils and pimples on the head, just as we have mentioned.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofulas are many, for some are stony, and from those there are those that contain moisture, and from those are malignant which do not yield to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that one which you will treat with good disposition at the touch, of which the color of water that is evident is similar to the color of thread, and it swells on all sides, and is not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and does not spread, you must incise that in dry superfical layer from top to bottom part of the body along the line of G. within the line of B., and drain that from all sides, and extend the lips of the thread for about an inch, or for a few threads if it is necessary with them, just as we have said with the boils on the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And you must be even more careful not to incise the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And be careful that the spatula does not touch too much, so it does not adhere to your hand when you incise, or irritate the patient, and do not incise something that is not necessary; for if you cut a vein or artery and prevent blood flow from them, immediately stop your operation, apply plaster or other powders which stop bleeding, and strengthen the wound, and leave it inside until the swelling of the abscess subsides and the wound softens and begins to heal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	So return to your operation as soon as you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then investigate with the same carefulness if there remains any cause of other small scrofulous swellings, so that you incise them and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if the great vein is in the root of the large scrofula, be careful and do not incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Bend it carefully so that the thread is doubled strong and then leave it inside, letting it fall by itself without doing any harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old linen cloth which you have already moistened in Egyptian ointment, and take care of that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut out the whole scrofula, be careful that you close the two lips of the wound and suture them right away, so that there is not any unnecessary residue.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	And if it happens that there is some unnecessary residue due to the size of the scrofula, be careful and understand that you must incise the root of it, and extract it, and then administer a suture and that which is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And the scrofulas that contain humidity, pierce that with a shallow perforation in the place where you see the spot of maturation, and stop piercing from below the body, just as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation, with ointment and some resemblance to those [other treatments], so that it rots out what remains of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then, when you see the wound already cleaned, be careful and cure it with flesh-generating ointment so that it is healed.

The content appears to be a detailed guide on how to treat scrofula, which was a type of skin condition also known as the "King's Evil". De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	The cutting of the flesh around an abscess that has formed suddenly on the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They used to call this cutting in the flesh an epilhot, and we do not see any man in our country who has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their sermon.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with a severe condition, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of the epilhot, because otherwise there would be no nourishment for the patient, as all his veins and arteries are nearby.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses in the mouth or groin or both ears, when the illness is not in the throat, it is necessary to use the cutting of the epilhot to avoid the destruction which is caused by its completion.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, it is necessary to cut the epilhot below three circles of the epilhot circles, or four at small section by latitude in that which is between two circles for quantity, so that the cut be in cartilage, not in the flesh, and this place is convenient for cutting, because it is deprived of flesh and vessels of blood from there are absent.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the surgeon is fearful, it is necessary to wait for the time when he extends the knife of the groin as soon as possible, and carefully cut the cord in such a way that he reaches the canal. But he should avoid the blood vessels if you see them from some cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And thus, insert the cupping glasses as we have prescribed; and it is significant above the section of the vein by the flame which issues from them, for it is that which has been released from him and through the emission of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound stay open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	So when the hour is re-established in which the puncture is to be feared, add two folds of the linen from the wound, and sew up that sole with a single stitch.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And thus administer medicines that make the flesh grow within so it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Zahrawi (Albucasis) says that the purpose of this treatment is not only to remove the pustules from the wound, but also that if some have already filled with pus and the patient has come close to death, and their breath has become dry, and some are going to cut into the epiglottis so that the sick person can breathe over the site of the wound through any respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And because of this I command that the wound be left open until the disease's evil is consumed; and it is three days for its evil to leave; and thus, every hour I command to sew up the wound, and to cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	I have seen in my practice as a physician that a servant took a knife and thrust it into the patient's throat and cut out a portion of the lung, and I was summoned to cure him, and I found the spirit escaping just like from the dead, and I uncovered the wound and found the blood which had welled up from the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	So I confessed that he had not cut a vein or artery, and the breath was escaping from the wound, and I cured him until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not charge the servant anything unless he would cough out the voice, and after a few days he returned to his normal disposition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the gallbladder there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	It seems like we've reached the end of a medieval medical text, likely "Tacuinum Sanitatis", a famous 12th-century health manual written by an unknown author. The text was written in Latin and later translated into various languages, including Old Spanish.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	A swelling caused by a rupture or protrusion in the groin area, which is commonly called an inguinal hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This type of swelling, also known as a hernia of the groin, is quite large in size and often occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it can occur in two ways, either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the case of a natural one, there is no cure for it.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental type occurs in two ways: one similar to fatty tumors, and the other similar to a swelling caused by an obstruction of an artery, and in that case there is danger.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it's not advisable to make an incision unless the swelling is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you find it similar to a fatty tumor and it's not suspended by any of the veins, then you should incise it in the same way as the nodules, extract the contents from it with water, and close up. And if not, then carefully explore its entire nature, and apply care to the place that needs treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	It seems we've reached the end of a medieval medical text, likely "The Book of Medicines" (Llibre de Medicina) attributed to Arnald of Villanova. This text appears to be discussing hernias and their treatment, with some interesting historical insights into the understanding of anatomy and surgery during that time period.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	It seems we're jumping back into a section on the classification of nodules (or tumors). This text appears to be discussing different types of nodules, possibly in relation to medical diagnosis or treatment.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	The swollen lymph nodes are mentioned in the previous section and I will explain all their kinds there.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And you must tell them so that they know the difference between a node and an abscess, so they won't be confused.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	So you say that an abscess is a hot, feverish, and painful condition inside where the bubbling of the excess fluids subsides; and it's complete putrefaction which then ceases the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node is not hot, nor feverish, nor painful, and it contains that hard white mass which we call the lymph.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a cheese and it becomes firmer like wax, whether large or small, and they are in two kinds, which are fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, as you said earlier in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	So to summarize, when it comes to treating a node, you should first probe it with the instrument called an intromess, and then ask questions about its shape in the chapter that is closest to this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all kinds of nodes, where you take the instrument and insert it into the most humid location that you find in the abscess, and then you turn the handle slowly until you know that the instrument has pierced the capsule.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then you adjust the handle to a degree that corresponds to the size of the abscess, and then you extract the intromess and examine what is left in its place. (Note: This phrase appears to be referring to the contents or matter extracted from the abscess with the intromess)
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if it is forgotten that the current moisture, whatever its color may be, will flow from the incision made in the superficial section, as I have said in other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture left in the place where the intromess was, then you should know that it is fatty (or contains fatty tissue).
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	...and dry over it with a section without the shape of a cross, as this figure shows:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	...just as it has been shown to you, and suspend that over the incision, and scrape off the capsule from all sides with ease, and preserve the skin or sac, if possible, on top of it and extract the pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, it will not be possible to extract that pus, and most often it becomes infected, and then you should remove it as best you can, until there is no longer any cause for concern.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	And so if there is still any cause, little or much, the node will return as before. (This suggests that a successful treatment of the abscess is not guaranteed and that it may recur)
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if there is still some small part left, then you should fill the wound with sharp and strong corrosive powders and apply a compress to it, placing it where the abscess was located carefully, and treat that area with another kind of treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it's a large node, then you should cut the two edges of it and treat that area with the same treatment as for a carbuncle (encarnação is likely referring to a type of skin infection or abscess).
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulse is contrary (i.e. weak or absent) in that location, then you should abstain and not touch it for three days or four until the wound has settled down and the ebullition of the pus has ceased; and only then return to cut out what remains of the node.

De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	A new topic!
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of these are the forms of tumors, and there are three species, that is to say a large one, a middle-sized one, and a small one.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of large tumor is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the middle-sized tumor is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small tumor is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They are made of iron, lead, and fallen limbs that are badly placed, so that the tumor forms in the swellings.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the shapes of operations, and they are called "albered" (or surgical instruments), and one of them is called "berid".
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And there are three species, which are large, middle-sized and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The shape of the great operation is that of a wolf.
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The shape of the middle-sized operation is also that of a wolf (but not exactly as the previous one).
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The shape of the small operation is again that of a wolf.
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	Consequently, these are for those swellings and exits and fistulas and buboes which occur because of the bones and other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are made round, big, like lemons, just as are the large needles with which the abscesses are stitched, and they are made of citrus wood, or oak, or iron, or silver. And the best ones are those that are made of citrus wood.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	The surgeon makes incisions with black lead, which are believed to open up fistulas in their cavities and cause them to be reflected into the surrounding area due to their weight.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	They come in three types: some are long, some are middling, and some are short, depending on the size of the fistula and its constriction.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	Shape of the large incision instrument made of lead.
Forma del experient migier de plom:	Form of the expert plumber of lead:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	You corrected yourself!
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The forms of tumors are of many special kinds, because some of them are simple, which have only a single curvature, and there are three kinds: large, small, and mixed.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And from them (the kinds of tumors) some are fleshly, and there are three kinds.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And from those some tumors have two curvatures, and there are three kinds.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And from them some have three curvatures, and there are three kinds.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	Shape of a large single tumor, shape of an ulcer.
Forma de unci simple migier:	Shape of a mixed single tumor.
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	Shape of a small single tumor, shape of an ulcer.

Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	Shape of a mixed tumor that has three curvatures.

Forma de scapel gran:	A large form of scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Form of small scalpel.
Forma de scapel pauc:	Form of a little scalpel.
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The sharp edges of those with which the section is made are sharp, and the other ends are not sharp, and they are not held in such a way, but so that it can be done well in the excision of nodes, the fear of puncture of veins or nerves, and for these to heal well the patient and also tranquility a little from the adaptation which you will find necessary for the excision of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of bandages, and they are of three kinds: large, small, and little, as you see.
La forma de magda gran:	The form of a great pad.
Forma de magda migier:	Form of a small pad.
Forma de magda pauc:	Form of a little pad.
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made from linen and resemble a thread where alcohol is made.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it has a pointed edge with hidden stitches and on both sides of the division inside and outside, when you want, as you often see.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of splints, which are hidden among the said stitches for the excision of abscesses and do not pierce the patients, and they are of three kinds: great, small, and little.

Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of wind afflictions from which the flow of blood is cut off, and there are three species; great, medium, and small.
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	Their edges are bitter, rounded in some length, and subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And you must have these three species of wind afflictions, great, medium, and small, in order that through them you cut off the flow of blood with speed as it is needed, and when to your mind they do not seem like medicine at first.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	But you should not use them to cut off blood everywhere in the body, and you should only use them on fleshy places, such as in the soles of the legs and hips, and in the nipples and belly and groin, and similar to theirs are the fleshy folds of humans.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes they are made of those small instruments similar to short needles, according to this shape; through which the blood is cut off when it is done by bleeding with a lancet, or from an incision in a vein or artery.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the treatment of men's breasts which are assembled from women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some old women are swollen in men's breasts while they are sleeping just like children start to grow, and similarly the breasts of women and Roman apostles become inflamed.

And when you have done this, it is necessary that the cut should be made in accordance with the lunar cycle in this form, from line .B. to line .G., and then excise the entire tumor, and then fill the wound with red medicine, and then sew up the two lips of the wound with a suture, and cure him within which he will be healthy.

E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat. De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	The opening of abscesses that form beneath the nipple.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Those abscesses that form beneath the nipple are of the scrofulous kind, hard ones, which contain a core that is to be extracted.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. Capitol .xlix.	It seems like we've reached the end of a medieval medical text, possibly "The Book of Healing" by Al-Rhazes or another similar work. The content is related to abscesses and their treatment.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Incisions for abscesses that occur due to archery or from a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the bowstring is broken and the cord above it has been consolidated, then frequently seen abscesses occur. And the signs by which one can be known that inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or vein: for when abscess is due to a bowstring is long swollen in the chest; and if you prick the abscess with the needle, you will feel in it what sound it makes.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from a vein is around the navel of the chest.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the incision over this abscess is an error, and most especially in those that are behind the elbow, and in the armpits, and in the neck, and in various parts of the chest; and it is very large, so a cure with iron should be avoided, and that which is in the extremities or on the head should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But over that which is due to the inflammation of the wound from the bowstring, one should cut in two the incision along the cord; and bring the incision with the forceps close to the artery, and deliver it out of its tunics while it is still being uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then place on top of it the needle and make that penetrate into the other side, and tie the artery with double thread in two places, — this method is the one which you taught your apprentice for extracting two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then press on the place between the two ligatures with a spatula until all the blood is drawn out and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which poultice is made to be applied until the ligatures fall out, and care that one with suitable ointments is applied to it until it heals.

E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And the patient's hands are placed in the places of assistance or on the thigh, or anywhere where the joints are swollen.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, and it appears to be the same color as the rest of the body, and it is located in the larger parts of him, disposed in such a way that when it is very close to death, the patient seems to be in a state of shock.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess formed in the front of the body, and because of this it leaves a cord behind, and the patient is swollen all over and does not move to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	So from those that are in the joints it is not necessary to be bound with iron, because very little would cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is on the head or on the forehead should have a cord of spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, let it be bound with bandages and incise it with the lancet.

And if it is severe, then suspend the patient with pulleys, and let out that which was excised, and return the wound to its normal state by suturing it, and heal him until he is cured.

E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in his abdomen were two swellings which were similar to fungi, and there was no difference between them, being white.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were turned inward and split open, and moisture flowed from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	So you will cut them open and find in one about 18 ounces and the other about 6 ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation when cutting into them is that you should consider it bad if the patient is humid, and the color of the tumor is white, humid, of subtle texture; then you will cut it with a sharp steel spatula and in your presence apply fire to it, as soon as four or five times you see its surface dry up, expelling all blood; and if you feel the blood, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is poor and fearful, be careful not to cut with iron; rather take some fresh lead wire, and wrap it around that tumor, in the manner which we have said; and leave that on for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust it in the constriction of the lead thread; therefore do not stop tightening the great lead until it is severed and falls off by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if it is of great size, the length of time in the incision of him causes some cause for fear and pain, especially in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But possibly you can incise most of it, and then cauterize that part so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then care for him until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And take care that you do not presume to incise him whose flesh is of dark color, with little sensation, and with poor regulation, for that is a very bad cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come to remind you of this warning again.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	A new chapter!
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The swelling of the navel is caused by various reasons; or due to tears in the belly skin that expose the intestine or hernia, depending on where it bursts; or due to an incision from a vein or artery, as previously mentioned, or due to wind trapped in him.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it's due to a tear in the belly skin and the exposure of the intestine, the colour of the abscess is similar to the colour of the flesh; and it has a lion-like pain, and appears from different situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it's due to the protrusion of the intestine, then its situation is like that which we have recounted, but with a more violent and diverse variety; as you press around that place, it becomes hidden, and then returns; and very quickly, it becomes swollen there, and it makes a loud moaning sound when you try to push it back in with great force.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it's due to humidity, then its pain is intense and does not become hidden when you press around the affected area with your hand; nor is it constricted or hardened.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it's due to blood, then the abscess will have these signs: the abscess will appear as if it were turning black and declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it's due to gangrened flesh, then the abscess is grave, large, hard, and swollen according to its quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it's due to flatulence, then the touch of the affected area is intense.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation to be performed there is what you consider necessary when the navel's prominence is due to arterial bleeding, or from a vein, or from flatulence; and now it is advisable that you should prohibit yourself from touching or treating it, for fear and anxiety are as intense as what I have taught in the chapter where I spoke of abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the navel's prominence is due to intestinal or bowel issues, then you should command the patient to lie on their back and extend their legs; and then send someone to clean around the entire umbilical area, and have them command the patient to hold their breath between your two hands, and then encircle a spatula or similar instrument around the umbilical area at the spot where you had indicated the catheter; and then stretch most of the abscess upwards towards the upper parts by great force, and then tie it in the circuit with strong thread or cord, using the proper method for tying.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then, with the patient still in that position, grasp the tip of the abscess that has been stretched over the ligature and insert your finger into it, seeking the bowel; and if you have found or feel the bowel through the ligature, then you should extract the instrument and push the bowel towards the inner parts of the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the membrane (tela), then take hold of it with the forceps and excise its excess parts.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas. De curacio de cranc.	Treatment of stone disease.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said that the type of stone and the manner in which it is treated with medicine, and what to avoid during treatment so that it does not become ulcus-ed. We have also said that the stone generated from the most careful and greatest treatment of it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that some types of stones are found in places where it is possible to eradicate them, such as kidney stones or bladder stones and similar formations to those found in certain limbs, so they try to remove all that, especially when it's small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, one should not try to remove it because you cannot cure that kind or have seen any other, nor has it been known to reach that point.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation for it is when it is located as we have said, which means that you precede with a treatment and leave the patient to purge out black bile some times, and then attach a poultice to it, if there is a clear manifestation of blockage.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then you prepare the patient with a preparation in which the operation will be located, and you prohibit certain foods that are not good for it; and you concave all parts of the intestine so that there is a good examination to ensure that no cause of its diseases remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow and do not stop it lightly, and express the areas, and abstain from the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument with which you are most able among the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a contraindication of thick blood, such as an incision in a vein or artery, you should cauterize it until the bleeding has ceased, and then treat the patient with other treatments until they are healed.

De curacio de ydropici.	A treatment for dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted and divided the types of dropsy by water, and marked each type, for the treatment of it with medicines.

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	The children who are born with holes in their urinary tract.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some time after some of the children are born, their head is still in the womb and their skull cap is not yet pierced (or it is pierced straight or not at all).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	So you should cut the piercing of them as soon as they are born with a thin spatula in this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then stop up the hole with a small iron nail of lead and tie it, and you'll keep them for three days or for four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when they want to urinate they should be made to vomit and then they can urinate; and then tie it back up again.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you don't stop the lead [plug], it's likely that the urine which runs over the hole won't let this abscess form.

De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	When the foreskin becomes inflamed, swollen, and covered in pus, and sticks to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Severe swellings often occur on the penis and become like fleshy prominences.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one is malignant and the other is not.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Not malignant, you should suspend it with a fine cord and cut off the whole part that is swollen; then apply a poultice to the place beneath the navel in Egyptian ointment; and when the day has passed, change the poultice into fine powdered ointment until he is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the inflammation is malignant, with foul odor, you should administer cauterization around the opening and the root of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the inflammation is in the foreskin of an uncircumcised penis, and one part of it is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you should first treat the part that is inside from the beginning until it consolidates; and then cure the part that is outside, for when you cure the whole thing together with the foreskin, it's not certain that it won't get entangled.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if there are ulcers or abscesses in the genital area and foreskin, with darkening and corruption, then you should cauterize all that which has already become corrupted and is going to corrupt further or has already been corrupted; and apply a paste on top of it made from honey mixed with ground almonds, grated and sifted bread, and crushed seeds.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And you should apply the other treatment to that area until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	If there's an outpouring of blood, then administer a lunar cautery in this way:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Four cauteries are useful at two dispositions together, that is to say, for bleeding and for a corrupted wound.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and completely destroyed in a moment, you will need to insert a lead pipe into the sheath of the prepuce so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adherence of the prepuce to the head of the penis (and this does not occur except in that whose prepuce is healthy and there is no requirement for circumcision; and when the adherence occurs due to wound or suppurating ulcer) you will need to excise the obtuse spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the penis is completely freed.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament. De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	The cleansing of children and the treatment of those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution to the continuity of the same kind as other ailments: but since it is our operation and our will, and those of them are properly in children, it is necessary that we assign to that better operation and via most easy lost to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	So I say that the ancients did not practice circumcision among them in their free times, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, which reason is why I have found the most part of surgeons and barbers to circumcise and clean with a razor and with hot irons; and they use it without a file and with inscription on the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already condemned all these methods and I did not find better cleansing with scissors, with file that in cleansing like the nail, because most times you escape the thread higher up, because the thread of the foreskin has two tunics, and leaves the lower tunic, and it is quite easy to force it to another inscription and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And with the cleansing which is done by alphecati, and it's digital, which barbers use, the inscription of the end of the male member is not ensured, because quite easily it goes into the channel of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	When performing an operation, you should have a nail or pointed instrument handy, so that if necessary, you can quickly stop the bleeding with iron.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the child's cord is naturally short, and many times it falls in such a way that there has been no need for cutting, and I have seen this.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	However, the cutting that is done with scissors and later with a needle has been known to me through experience, because the blades are of disproportionate size, so that the sharpness above is easier than the sharpness below; and therefore when you press your hand so that both sharpness is proportioned, and cut it according to a comparison in one time; and it is made a compression of the needle with a figure containing the cord of the penis from all parts, with which there is no error at all.
