De sermo en dislocacio.	A speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the disarrangement of some of the joints from their proper place, by which it is prohibited for them to move, and the figure of the member is deformed, and great pains and injuries come upon the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore when accident befalls someone with a dislocation, it is necessary to perform an operation to reduce it at once, and do not delay that reduction, for if it is delayed, the place becomes inflamed and very little water can be given to it and the reduction of the dislocation becomes very difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And therefore it should not be moved or stretched during the time of inflammation, for most often it brings on spasms and sharp pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when that happens, it is necessary for you to cut yourself to the patient's apothecary, and let them put on the plaster as soon as the inflammation has calmed down; and meanwhile the member should be wrapped in warm water and oil, and then reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the patient should be cured with water from which a memory of the incident will come back to them.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the capital bones of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the highest part of the body up to the lowest.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Capítulo xxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the treatment of a jaw dislocation below.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	The two jaws are dislocated if they do not fit; and the dislocation of both is made in one of two ways: either they are reattached to their places with a little traction, and slightly softened; or they are completely dislocated and closed, until they are softened at the joint between them, so that the patient can neither speak nor close their mouth, and the tongue of him is wrapped around his saliva.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation of him is slight, in most cases it returns by itself with a little effort.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is complete and closed, in those cases it is necessary that reduction be administered to him gently, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the administrator should have a grip on the patient's head, and insert his fingers into the right position in the joint of the jaw dislocation inside the patient's mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or he inserts both his thumbs together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other hands are outside with which to guide them. And he tells the patient to close their jaws and let those go in whichever direction they want to go, and the administrator guides the jaw and pushes it back into its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	If the reduction is difficult and especially if both jawbones are dislocated, then administer a mixture of warm water and oil, so that the reduction of both becomes easy and you do not delay the reduction of both altogether.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so how to close them and get gummed up, and the patient's mouth is closed but not softened, then you put some cotton wool pads on top of it made from wax and oil that have been melted together; and attach them with ease and gentle ties.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient lies on their back, and their head is placed between two straps, so that they do not open their mouth to the right or left; and you should not force them to chew any food; but have a sponge soaked in vinegar ready, until the pains are relieved and the jawbones are knitted together again, then you can give them something to eat.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this is administered with ease, and you should not work hard to open their mouth for eating and drinking and other activities, until the jawbone is knitted together and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jawbones is difficult when they are dislocated and not easily put back into place, then you should see to it that the patient suffers from bad events and constant fever, and the belly of the sick person is frequently loosened with a strong purge, and soon afterwards vomit pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you try this, then you should know that it is a waste; and very often the person who suffers from this will die within 10 days.
Capitol .xxv.	Title of Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of a dislocation of the shoulder blade (or collarbone) and of an arm.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The shoulder blade is not dislocated from the front part by its continuity with the ribcage; and sometimes it is dislocated towards the outside, and this is declared by the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the patient lies on their back and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And bring it close, with a firm grasp, in the location of your palm, so that it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And place it on that plaster and powder to strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which has been cooled and is continuous with it, is not dislocated on any day; hours can pass until it should be reduced and joined as we have said and according to your equipment.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And place it on that plaster, and powder, and bandage, and command the patient to keep quiet and rest until they are healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And by this same method of treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its location.
Capitol .xxvi.	Book XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of a joint dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated in three ways, one of which is where it has been dislocated from the joint.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it has been dislocated above the muscle, and thus it's a simple fact; and it's not dislocated behind because of the shoulder blade; and it's not dislocated in front due to the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most of the time it is dislocated and protruding in the lower parts of the joint, and mostly in those where the flesh is scant, it is dislocated lightly; but in those with much flesh, it comes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And quite often an accident of blow or fall occurs to some men and the muscle becomes inflamed with a suppurating abscess, and this is a sign that it was already dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then I understand what you're getting at, and that's the point where you need to intervene immediately, and the hours that pass in the treatment of it. (Note: It seems like we've had a conversation about muscle dislocations in an old-fashioned style, perhaps influenced by medieval or Renaissance-era medical texts?)
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of it when it appears in the lower parts of the shoulder; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy one, because you find a manifest difference; and you find a concavity at the top of the muscle, and below the shoulder you feel the touch of the head of the muscle like a small bone, and to the sick person it is impossible to reduce its shoulder to its original position, nor can they move that part completely.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it's dislocated from the foot or in its vicinity, and you take a look, you'll find a clear and visible mark, and it won't be hidden. (It seems like we're getting into more specific details about muscle dislocations, perhaps related to the quadriceps muscle?)
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this type of dislocation a slight reduction is made when it's fresh and the patient is young. (It seems like we're discussing a scenario where the dislocation can be easily corrected if it happens to someone who is young or in good health.)
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises the hand up to the upper parts; and approaches the tendons with his fingers below the head of it, and lifts the joint with great force to its proper place, and the minister raises the hand up, and stretches it out; and approaches a pause so that it returns slightly. (It seems like we're describing a procedure for reducing a dislocated shoulder joint, where the healthcare provider uses a combination of manual manipulation and stretching to guide the bone back into place.)
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if through what we've said it doesn't return, and only the beginning of the dislocation is reached, then within a few days or hours it's necessary that the patient be bathed in warm water and administered a poultice to soften and calm the area, as if they had been burned with hot oil, and fennel, and melilot in water were given. (It seems like we're discussing a scenario where the dislocation cannot be reduced immediately, and instead the healthcare provider is advising a treatment of warm baths and topical applications to help reduce pain and inflammation.)
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And so the patient is placed on their back and positioned below the head of it, and a woolen cloth that is neither too loose nor too tight is wrapped around. And the physician places his leg over the shoulder, and lifts the head of the muscle with great force, and pulls the patient's hand to prevent it from being displaced again, and another minister holds the patient's head so that it is not displaced below, for then it will return to its place. (It seems like we're describing a more complex procedure where multiple people are involved in holding the patient and manipulating the dislocated joint to guide it back into place.)
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want to reduce it in this manner: and so you make present a man who is taller than the patient, and he stands on that side, and inserts his muscle below the head of the patient's muscle, and lifts the head of the patient up into the air, and another minister pulls the patient's hand away from their lower abdomen. (It seems like we're describing a procedure where an assistant uses their body and muscles to help lift and stabilize the patient's dislocated joint, while another assistant helps to prevent displacement by pulling on the patient's hand.)
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is very light, it is necessary that they be suspended by some means, in order to press down on the dislocation, for then it will quickly return to its place. (It seems like we're discussing a scenario where the patient's weight and body mass are not sufficient to apply enough pressure to reduce the dislocation, so additional support or suspension is needed to help correct the joint.)
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And so it is reduced easily in another manner: and this is that there be placed on the ground a long beam with its head rounded like a mortar pestle, not too thick nor too thin. And the patient's leg be placed below it; then they place the patient's foot on top of the beam, and the patient stretches out according to the length of the beam, and their hand is extended behind them in the other direction. And their body is stretched out from that side with great force, for then the joint returns to its place quickly. (It seems like we're describing a procedure where the patient is placed on a long beam, which serves as a fulcrum or lever, to help reduce the dislocation by applying pressure and stretching the affected limb.)
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	I cannot provide medical advice. If you are experiencing any symptoms or discomfort, I recommend that you seek help from a qualified healthcare professional.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And now place a soft cloth over his head so that he may not be disturbed by the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And now place the patient's pillow and have his arm stretched out over him between the openings below, and tie his hands to the aiders and arms and fingers.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Now place his arm on a scale according to the altitude, and have one hand extended below, and the other thing suspended from the other side, so that the junction takes place at once.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And with the instrument of him is completed in every manner that it is possible to you, and the hours that cover you that you place below the pillow a piece of woolen cloth of equal quantity; and now place prepared plaster powder made from millstone, ashes and egg white over all the muscle, thus as it is revolved above, and now strengthen below the pillow with tight bandage; and the ligament is revolved on the plaster, and his hand is attached to his neck, and be left, and let not his hand be moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the food of the patient be placed little, until the member be comforted, for it is lighter to his cure.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And now give him food more according to the seven or eight days and exercise a movement; and thus if it is stopped and not softened, the hours are already cured.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri. De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	The reduction is to be made by impulse and extension of the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then apply to that other stricture, and cure it until it's healed.

And if the patient suffers from gravity in the member and slowness of movement, the doctor uses warm baths several times until that gravity is alleviated and he returns to his original nature.

De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, and most in the front part against the back part, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you as long as the swelling or touch remains according to which figure is dislocated; and when you adjust the dislocated hip with the hand, it is clearly declared to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the leg, nor touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And it is necessary that you reduce the hip as quickly as possible before it becomes septicemic, because if it comes to septicemia, it is difficult to reduce it, and even with great effort, it does not fully heal; and most so when it is in the back parts, for being worse than all other types of dislocation, and causing greater pain, and many times they die from that.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the reduction of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that you extend your hand with two fingers, and the arm of the patient be stretched out, and the hands of the doctor be on top of the hip and below it, and he pushes the joint with the pads of his fingers together, or with the back of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, it returns similarly that way as you bend your hand with its fist, until you strike the hip with the back of your palm. (This translation implies a more forceful and direct action than the previous one)
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey to the reduction, then you administer violent extension and strong force. (This translation implies a more aggressive and forceful approach than the previous one)
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two assistants extend the leg, and they hold that support with two assistants by so that it does not fall from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And now have the arms of the patient be turned around completely, because cloth folded long over his hand is wrapped around them.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he makes sure there is some oil for that, so that those causes which facilitate lubrication of the joint are helped; and then he presses the joint with a strong push until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of him must be paused over that poultice in which he is plastered and where an egg white paste has been applied to hold it tightly, and his arm suspended from the neck, and left for a few days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be unwrapped; and so if the joint is formed in its place, wait until you unwrap the bandage from him and leave that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not yet strengthened, then wait until you reapply the poultice and bandage again, and leave it for a few more days until it has dried out; and afterwards unwrap it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if something happens to him in the process of reducing the joint, and his condition is that he is moving around, then you should administer moisture treatment in a warm bath and subtle friction, and compression, until it is alleviated; or pause over the joint, as it were, an oil slick; and afterwards apply a bandage, and leave it on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And afterwards, stop that and put him in the bath; and when he's done, then you should rub the joint with a temperate friction, and afterwards apply over it again, as it were, an oily coating, once, and a second time, and a third time.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	with bathing instruments until it is clean.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want to, pause over that moistened and scarified wound with the border of a cow's hide, and press strongly on it; and do this several times, because it is moist and reduces itself to its natural state.
